intro: Spermacoce molleri, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its fruits are small, spherical berries that turn red when mature, attracting birds and other wildlife. Spermacoce molleri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
